content.description: Start with hand on the flake near the top of the boulder and one hand on the side near the lip, work your way up and make the reach for the lip.
content.location: On the riverside of the boulder the side with the flake at the bottom of the stairs right next to the boulder.

content.description: Start on the left corner of the boulder facing the trail. Put one hand in a good hold on the lower left lip of the boulder and the other on the sloper of the lip. Work your way right towards the highest point of the boulder and climb up the face.
content.location: Follow the Yankee Horse trail at mile marker 34.4 BRP, take the railroad right to the stream and follow the stream up to the boulder. This problem is on the trail side of the boulder.

content.description: Next to river with decent shade all around from trees. Named after a stone found in the jug halfway up the riverside of the boulder which creepily or beautifully, depending on how you want to look at it, had "Death Did Them Part" written on it. Please leave stone if still there, as well as limit cleaning of holds as it is frowned upon on the Parkway.
